eMeasure Title Bipolar Disorder and Major Depression: Appraisal for alcohol or chemical substance use
eMeasure Identifier
(Measure Authoring Tool)		 89 eMeasure Version number 0
NQF Number 0110 GUID c24c69e6-d38d-4695-bd18-8b3adfd743fa
Measurement Period January 1, 20xx through December 31, 20xx
Measure Steward Center for Quality Assessment & Improvement in Mental Health (CQAIMH)
Measure Developer Center for Quality Assessment & Improvement in Mental Health (CQAIMH)
Endorsed By National Quality Forum
Description 
Percentage of patients with depression or bipolar disorder with evidence of an initial assessment that includes an appraisal for alcohol or chemical substance use.
Copyright 
Center for Quality Assessment & Improvement in Mental Health (CQAIMH)
Disclaimer 
This measure is an initial eSpecification of the endorsed measure, and has not been field tested.
Measure Scoring Proportion
Measure Type Process
Stratification 
None
Risk Adjustment 
None
Rate Aggregation 
None
Rationale 
Individuals with bipolar disorder or major depression have high rates of co-morbid substance abuse and should be screened for substance use disorders. Between 40-70% of people with bipolar disorder have a history of substance use disorder. A current or past co-morbid substance use disorder may lead to worse outcomes for bipolar disorders, including more symptoms, more suicide attempts, longer episodes and lower quality of life. Substance abuse may obscure or exacerbate mood swings that have no other apparent external cause. Substance abuse may also precipitate mood episodes or be used by patients to self-treat in an attempt to improve the symptoms of episodes. Patients suffering from major depressive disorder with co-morbid addiction are more likely to require hospitalization, more likely to attempt suicide and less likely to comply with treatment than are patients with these disorders of similar severity not complicated by these factors.
Clinical Recommendation Statement 
"Perform a diagnostic evaluation ... [to] assess for the presence of an alcohol or substance use disorder or other factors that may contribute to the disease process or complicate its treatment. (American Psychiatric Association, Practice Guideline for the Treatment of Patients with Bipolar Disorder, Am J Psychiatry 159: 4, April 2002 Supplement)

A complete diagnosis of depression should address ... history of substance use and treatment for substance use disorders. (American Psychiatric Association, Practice Guideline for the Treatment of Patients with Major Depressive Disorder, 2000)"
Improvement Notation 
Higher score indicates better quality
Reference 
"1. Ostacher, MJ; Sachs, GS, Update on Bipolar Disorder and Substance Abuse: Recent Findings and Treatment Strategies, J Clin Psychiatry 2006; 67[9]:e10
2. Regier DA, Farmer ME, Rae DS, et al. Comorbidity of mental disorders with alcohol and other drug abuse: results from the Epidemiologic Catchment Area (ECA) Study, JAMA 1990; 264:2511-1518
3. American Psychiatric Association, Practice Guideline for the Treatment of Patients with Bipolar Disorder, Am J Psychiatry 159: 4, April 2002 Supplement
4. American Psychiatric Association, Practice Guideline for the Treatment of Patients with Major Depressive Disorder (2000)
Definition 
None
Guidance 
None
Transmission Format 
TBD
Initial Patient Population 
Patients 18 years of age or older at the start of the measurement period.
Denominator 
Patients in the Initial Patient Population with a new diagnosis of Unipolar Depression or Bipolar Disorder during the first 323 days of the measurement period, and evidence of treatment for unipolar depression or Bipolar Disorder within 42 days of diagnosis.   The existence of a 'new diagnosis' is established by the absence of diagnoses and treatments of unipolar depression or Bipolar Disorder during the 180 days prior to the diagnosis.
Denominator Exclusions 
None
Numerator 
Patients in the denominator with evidence of an assessment for alcohol or other substance use on the same day as initiation of treatment or earlier.  (Note:  the endorsed measure calls for the assessment to be performed prior to discussion of the treatment plan with the patient, but the current approach was considered more feasible in an EHR setting.)   The "Assessment for Alcohol or Other Drug Use" required in the numerator is meant to capture an assessment, performed by the provider, using either defined instruments that are not specified (see the STABLE documentation for details on some available instruments) of through evaluation of the patients symptoms.  The essence of the measure is to avoid treating the patient for unipolar depression or Bipolar Disorder without an assessment of their use of alcohol or other drugs.
Numerator Exclusions 
None
Denominator Exceptions 
None
Measure Population 
None
Measure Observations 
None
Supplemental Data Elements 
None

Population criteria

  • Initial Patient Population =
    • AND: "Patient Characteristic Birthdate: birth date" >= 18 year(s) starts before start of "Measurement Start Date"
  • Denominator =
    • AND: "Initial Patient Population"
    • AND: FIRST:
      • OR: "Diagnosis, Active: BH Condition involving bipolar disorder"
      • OR: "Diagnosis, Active: BH Condition involving unipolar depression"
      • during ("Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter" starts after start of "Measurement Start Date")
    • AND: FIRST:
      • OR: "Diagnosis, Active: BH Condition involving bipolar disorder"
      • OR: "Diagnosis, Active: BH Condition involving unipolar depression"
      • during ("Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter" >= 42 day(s) starts before start of "Measurement End Date")
    • AND: FIRST:
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Medication, Order: BH Antidepressant medication" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Procedure, Order: BH Counseling for depression" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Procedure, Performed: BH Counseling for depression" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Procedure, Order: BH Electroconvulsive therapy" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Procedure, Performed: BH Electroconvulsive therapy" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Medication, Order: BH Mood stabilizer medication" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Encounter, Order: BH Outpatient psychotherapy" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Encounter, Recommended: BH Outpatient psychotherapy" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
    • AND:
      • AND NOT: "Diagnosis, Active: BH Condition involving unipolar depression" during "Occurrence B of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • AND NOT: "Diagnosis, Active: BH Condition involving bipolar disorder" during "Occurrence B of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • AND NOT: "Medication, Order: BH Mood stabilizer medication"
      • AND NOT: "Medication, Active: BH Antidepressant medication"
      • AND NOT: "Procedure, Order: BH Counseling for depression"
      • AND NOT: "Procedure, Order: BH Electroconvulsive therapy"
      • AND NOT: "Procedure, Performed: BH Electroconvulsive therapy"
      • AND NOT: "Encounter, Order: BH Outpatient psychotherapy"
      • AND NOT: "Medication, Active: BH Mood stabilizer medication" during "Occurrence B of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • AND: "Medication, Active: BH Antidepressant medication" during "Occurrence B of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • AND: "Procedure, Performed: BH Counseling for depression"
      • < 180 day(s) starts before start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
  • Denominator Exclusions =
    • None
  • Numerator =
    • AND: "Occurrence A of Procedure, Performed: BH Assessment for alcohol or other drugs" >= 0 day(s) starts before start of FIRST :
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Medication, Order: BH Antidepressant medication" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Procedure, Order: BH Counseling for depression" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Procedure, Performed: BH Counseling for depression" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Procedure, Order: BH Electroconvulsive therapy" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Procedure, Performed: BH Electroconvulsive therapy" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Medication, Order: BH Mood stabilizer medication" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Occurrence A of Encounter, Order: BH Outpatient psychotherapy" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
      • OR: FIRST:"Encounter, Recommended: BH Outpatient psychotherapy" < 42 day(s) starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
    • AND: "Occurrence A of Procedure, Performed: BH Assessment for alcohol or other drugs" starts after start of "Occurrence A of Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter"
  • Denominator Exceptions =
    • None

Data criteria (QDM Data Elements)

  • "Diagnosis, Active: BH Condition involving bipolar disorder" using "BH Condition involving bipolar disorder Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.1504)"
  • "Diagnosis, Active: BH Condition involving unipolar depression" using "BH Condition involving unipolar depression Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.1505)"
  • "Encounter, Order: BH Outpatient psychotherapy" using "BH Outpatient psychotherapy Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.973)"
  • "Encounter, Performed: BH Outpatient encounter" using "BH Outpatient encounter Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.464.0001.49)"
  • "Encounter, Recommended: BH Outpatient psychotherapy" using "BH Outpatient psychotherapy Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.973)"
  • "Medication, Active: BH Antidepressant medication" using "BH Antidepressant medication Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.972)"
  • "Medication, Active: BH Mood stabilizer medication" using "BH Mood stabilizer medication Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.950)"
  • "Medication, Order: BH Antidepressant medication" using "BH Antidepressant medication Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.972)"
  • "Medication, Order: BH Mood stabilizer medication" using "BH Mood stabilizer medication Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.950)"
  • "Patient Characteristic Birthdate: birth date" using "birth date LOINC Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.560.100.4)"
  • "Procedure, Order: BH Counseling for depression" using "BH Counseling for depression Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.1616)"
  • "Procedure, Order: BH Electroconvulsive therapy" using "BH Electroconvulsive therapy Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.1533)"
  • "Procedure, Performed: BH Assessment for alcohol or other drugs" using "BH Assessment for alcohol or other drugs Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.1604)"
  • "Procedure, Performed: BH Counseling for depression" using "BH Counseling for depression Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.1616)"
  • "Procedure, Performed: BH Electroconvulsive therapy" using "BH Electroconvulsive therapy Grouping Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.1257.1.1533)"
